title: X-HTDC method for better estimation of particulate phosphorus in microalgae
title_html: X-HTDC method for better estimation of particulate phosphorus in microalgae

protocol.title: X-HTDC method for better estimation of particulate phosphorus in microalgae

source.description: KH2PO4 primary standard stock solution (≈ 1 mM)
Transfer about 1 g KH2PO4 into a beaker, cover the beaker with foil
Move KH2PO4 into a vacuum desiccator, allow KH2PO4 to cool to room temperature

Dissolve around 0.136 g dried KH2PO4 in 1 L milliQ water.
  • Use 1 L volumetric flask
  • Take notes of the actual weight of KH2PO4 for final concentration of standard stock solution
Transfer standard stock solution into a 1 L bottle and store in the fridge.

source.body: This stock solution lasts quite a long time, unless there is evidence for growth of algae or other extraneous biotic material.

(1) The number of crucible
(2) The code of sample in the crucible

until samples are completely dry.

for

source.body: Map the location of crucibles in the oven, in case pencil mark disappears under 800°C.

Ramp rate should be controlled at < /hour, otherwise the crucibles will shatter.
SP.RAT: 150
PAMPU: hour

source.description: Cap the vial tightly and vortex

Place in a drying oven at
for
Cool down to
Transfer samples to centrifuge tubes

Total particulate or intracellular phosphorus sample and their blank Transfer 1 mL to 1.7~2 mL microtube
Lipid phosphorus sample and the blank: Transfer all liquid to 0.6 mL microtube
Standards: transfer the same volume as samples
Centrifuge at around 14K rpm for 5 min
Transfer supernatant to microtubes, avoid particulate ash or other residue
Working reagent

Calculate the volume of molybdate-ascorbic reagent:
Total volume of reagent (mL) = (0.5 mL) X (# standard working solutions + # samples + # blank) X 2

Mix the reagents into Falcon tube:
2 part MilliQ
1 part 6 N sulphuric acid
1 part 2.5% ammonium molybdate
1 part 10% ascorbic acid
Preheat incubator/shaker to
Add 500 ul reagent to each sample, standard and blank.

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7qma2","text":"This protocol describes how to prepare oxalate reagent, which is used to remove surface adsorbed phosphorus, so that the intracellular phosphorus quotas in microalgae can be quantified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bdpo3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f66dv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"7uiqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"citation","data":{"authors":"AntonioTovar-Sanchez, Sergio A Sa\u00f1udo-Wilhelmy, Manuel Garcia-Vargas, Richard S Weaver, Linda C Popels, David A Hutchins","can_edit":1,"date":null,"doi":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1016\/S0304-4203(03)00054-9","guid":"01891C70B0BA11EAA89EE71FB0FFEF12","id":500,"journal":"Marine Chemistry","protocol_id":null,"title":"A trace metal clean reagent to remove surface-bound iron from marine phytoplankton"}}]}

Subtract the average 820 nm absorbance measurement of the blank sample (filter) replicates from the 820 nm measurements of all other individual sample.
Prepare a standard curve by plotting the average Blank-corrected 820 nm measurement for eash standard versus its concentration in uM.
Use the standard curve to determine the orthophosphate concentration of each unknown sample by using its blank-corrected 820 absorbance.
P/sample_ug = (Orthophosphate_uM) X (HCl_mL X0.001) X 30.97

Allow samples to gradually cool down in the muffle furnace.

source.description:
HCl reagent:
Dissolve one part of
HCl in 59 parts of MilliQ water
Preheat oven to
Add 2.5 mL 0.2 M HCl to each crucible.
Gently swirl the crucible.
Cover the crucibles and place crucibles in the oven for
Cool samples down to
Gently swirl the crucible and then transfer 500 ul solution to 2 mL microtube. Duplicate each sample and blank.

6 N Sulfuric acid reagent
Carefully add 1 part 18 M concentrated sulfuric acid into 5 part MilliQ water

2.5 % ammonium molybdate reagent:
Weigh 0.25 g ammonium molybdate in a Falcon tube and top to 10 g with MilliQ water.
Cap and shake until totally dissolved.

10 % ascorbic acid reagent:
Weigh 1 g ascorbic acid in a Falcon tube and top to 10 g with MilliQ water;
Cap and shake until all dissolved.

source.body: Wrap the tube with foil if the reagent is not used right after prepared.

Subtract the average absorbance at 820 nm of the blank standard replicates from the absorbance at 820 nm of all other individual standard working solution.
Subtract the average absorbance at 820 nm of the blank sample (i.e. blank filter) replicates from the absorbance at 820 nm of all other individual sample.
Prepare a standard curve by plotting the average blank-corrected 820 nm absorbance for each standard working solution versus its concentration in uM.
Use the standard curve to determine the orthophosphate concentration of each unknown sample by using its blank-corrected 820 nm absorbance.
(P per sample)_ug = (orthophosphate)_uM X (V_HCl)_mL X (0.001) X (30.97)

description:
Here we describe a protocol using extra-high temperature dry combustion method (X-HTDC) to estimate particulate phosphorus in microalgae. The 800°C-combustion can completely decompose intracellular macromolecules. Thus the estimation of intracellular particulate phosphorus can be increased 10% compared with traditional 500 °C-combustion; while the estimation of total particulate phosphorus can be increased about 5%.
Microalgae is collected on PC filter and then combusted at 800 °C. Phosphate is then digested by 0.2 M HCl for 30 minutes incubated at 90°C. The resulted orthophosphate reacts with the mixture of molybdate and ascorbic acid to produce molybdenum blue (Chen 1956).
The working range of this assay is 0 ~ 200 uM orthophosphate. The recommended maximum phosphorus per sample is about 30 ug.
In order to assess the intracellular phosphorus quotas in microalgae, an oxalate reagent (Tovar-Sanchez 2003) is used to wash the sample collected on the filter to remove surface adsorbed phosphorus.
